text: <@U3DKG7M54|rahulhegde> has joined the channel

As per documentation, chaintool package is used to develop, package and deploy the user chaincode. will this be one of the OR the standard tool for assisting in chaincode development life cycle for v1.0 architecture?
<@U3DKG7M54> that depends on users like you adopting it
I am biased, of course...i would love for it to become the standard way to develop chaincode, and I designed it with that in mind
that said, the community needs to adopt it
fwiw, my team uses it internally for all of our projects
thanks <@U0KPFAZNF>; Let me try using it on *v1.0 architecture* using <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-chaintool/tree/master/examples/example02> as hello-world.
<@U3DKG7M54> cool...I know one weak spot right now is SDK support...you will have the least friction using the devmode deployment model
(or, really I should say, using any deployment model other than via SDK)
"peer chaincode deploy" CLI should work too
but I use devmode for most things these days
feel free to ping with any questions or feedback
<@U3DKG7M54> also note that you will want chaintool v0.9.1 for the v0.6 fabric release, and v0.10.0 for master
(v0.10.0 is also the latest release
Yes this  help - I want to try this on Master Branch (v1.0 architecture). I will use the CLI approach to deploy.
cool...also note that the REST api was deprecated in the master branch, so the REST based clients are not likely to work
ill try to get the example updated with the latest SDK for master ASAP
(sorry, master is still wet-bits)
fwiw, everything def works on v0.6, as I have multiple POCs based on it
thanks - peer YML disables REST by default though. I need to try this on v1.0.
I understand here - u have tried this on Master branch and using peer CLI interface
actually, no.  Everytime I sit down to try to go through and qualify the new stuff I get distracted by some othe fire
i desperately want to get this qualified on 1.0 though
I am exploring different methodology for deploying chaincode, can you please check. Do you have the CLI CL documentation available for reference.
ill try to take a look...i suspect that build/deployment works fine
the issue is going to be SDK examples
I need to port the current example to the new SDK
I think operationally, everything you need would be supported with the following exceptions
1) cant use the SDK to deploy (use devmode or CLI as discussed as a workaround)
2) no functioning example of a client with the new SDK
however, that said, you could take the node client (<https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-chaintool/tree/master/examples/example02/client/rest/nodejs>)
and work it into the SDK examples
the main thing is you basically need to take a standard client, and integrate the .proto stuff in so you can talk to the chaintool based chaincode
if you look at the node example here: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-chaintool/blob/master/examples/example02/client/rest/nodejs/index.js>
its primarily lines 4-10 to load the .proto
and then things like line 26 to encode
and thats it...other than that, its a vanilla SDK client example
ill try to get the SDK example in the tree ported ASAP

Ok - let me understand the process too - I checked the chaincode and I don't see invoke/query function. Not sure if this be wrapper by CCI interface 'query' alike section. I will post more question once I go through it.
for now the above information is good enough to start!
thanks <@U0KPFAZNF>.
<@U3DKG7M54> thats correct, chaintool will write the query/invoke for you
basically you define in the interface (as a .cci file) and then chaintool will write the minutiae that deals with the query/invoke calls, checking parameters, etc
you just write the functions that you declare in the CCI
<@U1Y4P0HM4|yangtao76> has joined the channel
